intro: Thinouia mucronata, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, spiny fruits and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans but may be consumed by certain wildlife. Thinouia mucronata is often found in regions with temperate to subtropical climates.
